Public Works Commission Agenda Report

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Several infrastructure projects in the city have upcoming milestones in design and construction. The Marie Canyon Green Streets project is finalizing biofilter designs with construction expected in Spring 2022. The PCH Median Improvements and Signal Synchronization projects await Caltrans approval, with both aiming to start construction by Spring/Summer 2022. Other projects, including the Civic Center Water Treatment Facility and Permanent Skate Park, are also progressing with design deadlines and scheduled construction, while updates for the Westward Beach Road improvements are pending

Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2

Preliminary estimated assessments were sent to all properties in Phase 2, and staff are maintaining communication with property owners regarding these assessments. An amendment to the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) has set a new deadline for forming the assessment district by June 30, 2022. In July, staff mailed easement documents to property owners for review and signing, followed by a follow-up letter. Capital Improvement Projects (Completed)

The Civic Center Way Improvements project has been completed, with the contractor finishing the maintenance period, and the City Council accepted it at their September 13th meeting. Additionally, the contractor has completed storm drain improvements in the Civic Center Way area, adding a 3-foot concrete curb to prevent brackish water from entering the stormwater treatment facility, with acceptance scheduled for January 24, 2022.
